abstract: In a contrite blog post, Mark Zuckerberg, the founder of Facebook, says his company has mishandled its Beacon system, which tells people’s friends about what they bought on line. The company has added a way to opt out.
snippet: In a contrite blog post, Mark Zuckerberg, the founder of Facebook, says his company has mishandled its Beacon system, which tells people’s friends about what they bought on line. The company has added a way to opt out.
lead_paragraph: Mark Zuckerberg has produced a symphony of contrition in a blog post today about Facebook’s Beacon feature, which initially sent information on users’ Web purchases to their friends unless they specifically blocked the disclosure of each purchase.

headline.main: Zuckerberg Apologizes, Allows Facebook Users to Evade Beacon
